definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

pinyin: bu4 que4 ding4 xing4 yuan2 li3

sentences.english: At last, the general equation for separation of high order definite err…
sentences.chinese: 最後給出了分離多階確定性誤差的通式。

sentences.english: Or have scientists been sexing up the risks and playing down the uncertainties?
sentences.chinese: 或者科學家對風險添油加醋，而貶低了不確定性？

sentences.english: Alternating between a deterministic and a non-deterministic node selection effectively solves the bottleneck problem.
sentences.chinese: 確定與非確定性節點選擇交替有效地解決了瓶頸問題。

sentences.english: These are all to result in of because the indetermination of the other party body.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是因爲對方身份的不確定性而造成的。

sentences.english: Uncertainty may exist in dealing with the mechanism of local uplift anomaly on dam foundation.
sentences.chinese: 壩基局部揚壓力異常機理的分析中通常存在不確定性。

sentences.english: Fear, mixed with a feeling of uncertainty, suddenly overwhelmed me.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼，混有一種感覺的不確定性，突然淹沒了我。

sentences.english: The net result is that uncertainty increases.
sentences.chinese: 最終的結果是不確定性增加。

sentences.english: The uncertainties are assumed to be time-varying and norm-bounded.
sentences.chinese: 假設是隨時間變化的不確定性和範數有界。

sentences.english: The verdict throws more uncertainty into the Republican rocky re-election bid.
sentences.chinese: 這個裁定給共和黨的連任選舉增加了更多的不確定性。

sentences.english: The Universal is therefore in point of fact the truth of sense-certainty, the true content of sense-experience.
sentences.chinese: 因此普遍的東西事實上就是感性確定性的真理性。

sentences.english: But there is much uncertainty about what it will involve.
sentences.chinese: 但是其所涉及的內容具有很多不確定性。

sentences.english: The Development of the Single-category View When Categorization Is Uncertain;
sentences.chinese: 證據理論是一種重要的不確定性推理方法。

sentences.english: The only proviso is that the bytecode modifications should be deterministic and predictable.
sentences.chinese: 惟一的要求是字節碼修改應該是確定性的且可預測的。

sentences.english: The threat of a nuclear crisis only adds to the uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 而且，核危機的威脅更加增加了這種不確定性。

sentences.english: You have to accept the uncertainty of the markets and be ready to take a small loss without quibbling .
sentences.chinese: 你還要接受市場的不確定性，不找藉口地接受小虧損。

sentences.english: Every piece of knowledge has inherent uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 每條知識都有內在的不確定性。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
